str2: A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Neuter Plural
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To give, grant, donate. Middle voice from doron; to bestow gratuitously.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Of great price, precious, honored.
And, even, also, namely.
Large, great, in the widest sense.
A promise. From epaggello; a self-committal.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
This; he, she, it.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
A sharer, partner, companion. From koinos; a sharer, i.e. Associate.
Divine; subst: the Deity. From theos; godlike: - divine, godhead.
From phuo; growth, i.e. natural production; by extension, a genus or sort; figuratively, native disposition, constitution or usage.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To flee from, escape. From apo and pheugo; to escape.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Corruption, destruction, decay, rottenness, decomposition. From phtheiro; decay, i.e. Ruin.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from the base of komizo; orderly arrangement, i.e. Decoration; by implication, the world (morally).
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Desire, eagerness for, inordinate desire, lust. From epithumeo; a longing.
